title: Valley of the Gods
review: This place is mesmerizing and consisting 124 small miniature and large temples mostly dedicated to lord Shiva all set in a blue pine or dheodhar pine forest. The main Shiva temples are easy to approach and the local priests help you with guidance and have a non commercial approach and adds to the magical experience. The government has developed clean bathrooms close by for pilgrims. This place is mystical and one should stay overnight to imbibe its beauty and charm. Being one of the eight jyotirlinga's of Shiva it is less crowded compared to the others. One can have a look at the site on google photos or youtube and enjoy. The temple architecture is so simple and beautiful like the local people who built it.

title: Spiritual and calming Temple
review: This was a magical experience. The entire Jageshwar  temple complex is amazing. This is one of the biggest temple in the entire complex.

title: 8th Century temple complex
review: There are 124 temples in this complex. All from 8th-9th century. Feels like been transported to a different era altogether. No matter if you are not religious. Visit sheerly to experience the aura.

title: Hindu Pilgrimage Town
review: 36 Kilometers far from Almora on the way to Pithoragarh road surrounded by deodar trees and dense forest,situated on beautiful valley,most important religious place dedicated to Lord Shiva and houses more than 125 temples, a small stream pass through the temple, the oldest temple was built in 8th century AD.There is a small Archaeological museum nearby the temple road,now the temple look after by archaeological survey of India.If you have visited Kumaon 1st time then not to be miss.

title: Mahamrityunjay temple jageshwar
review: How can one forget to visit this temple?Mahamrityunjay temple is the biggest and oldest in the jageshwar temple complex. It is strongly believed that visiting this temple is very special and one can also comes very close to god for few minutes.I have also visited here,it is really a nice temple.

title: Serene
review: The temple was beautiful and felt high on energy the environment was peaceful and one could feel the presence of serenity around . Lovely place. Mornings and evenings are good time to visit

title: Jageshwar jyotirlinga
review: One of the twelve joytilinga. This temple is having a blessed presence of lord shiva. In the temple complex there are other temples like Maha Mrityunjoy Mahadeb , Pusti Mata temple, Kuber temple etc

title: ONE OF THE OLDEST TEMPLE OF LORD SHIVA
review: It is one of the oldest and most popular temple of Lord Shiva.It is located in the vicinity of Jageshwar. The lingam of Lord Mahadev, found in this temple looks unique for its eye shaped opening. It is believed that people chanting the Mrityunjay Mantra get relief from the fear of death and gain immortality.There are 25 inscriptions on its wall and pillar which are considered from 7th to 10th century. Its language is Sanskrit and bramhi.

title: Jai Baba Mahamrityunjay
review: This temple is the part of Jageshwar Dham Temple Complex. A must visit during Shravan Month festival.

title: mahamartunjaya jap
review: The temple is located at Jageshwar just 35 Kms from Almora city this is India's only temple and has been worshiped of lord Shiva, & it is the only temple in the world where MAHAMARTUNJAYA JAP  are untertaken .

title: Lord Shiva Temple at Jageshwar Dham
review: Mahamrityunjay Temple is one of the temples in Jageshwar Dham of Lord Shiva. There are several Deodar Trees surrounding them making the place very cold. It is just place to go if your are near Almora.

title: very powerful temple
review: its a very old temple, very powerful shrines - not so commercialised so its apleasure to sit and do puja and get the feel without having to rush through just a quick darshan

title: I went down to the river and filled up a pot of water to offer it to the Deity.
review: As per popular belief it's a Temple made by the Gods. Very ancient. And seems like made by just stacking up stones.

title: Spiritual introspection
review: Peaceful spiritual place in lap of nature.the centuries old temples are magical and make us wonder how amazing our civilization is.

title: Third eye
review: The temple at jageshwar (quaint little town) is really really old and charming. The temple complex is itself a group of 125 small big temples including jyotirlinga and various others. The backdrop has huge deodar tress which looks majestic along with the jata-ganga river behind the temple. The Shiv lingum inside this temple has a third eye on it (looks divine). All the locals and pandits here have the same story to tell (with excitement). Temple opens at 4 and closes after evening aarti. You can choose any time to see the aarti being performed here. Avoid august month festival. Its really really crowded, heavy traffic, and sky high rates.

title: Amazing temple
review: The temple contains 124 sannadhis each with a Shivaling.  A river flows next to the temple and is surrounded by mountains!  The only place worth staying here is the KMVN resort

title: God's abode.Feel the Divine presence
review: I went to this temple to do mahamritunjay japam as i had some health issues and then again went to thank the God for miraculous healing. You can feel the Peace , divine presence here and the vibration here is very much positive and suitable for meditation and you will not feel like going from there. Beautiful place and wonderful god. We stayed there for 4 days once and 1 day 2nd time.Guest Houses are available and you can taste the local food.

title: Spiritual ,natural ,ancient ,silent ...no more words...
review: Jageshewar is very small beautiful town , jageshewar temple is group of temples situated on the bank of small river ,on the other bank there is deep forest ...

title: Not worth visiting unless for religious reasons
review: Seems like really sought after temple ...Landed up getting there as part of sightseeing only to find it completely commercialised and not soulful despite the numbers of years of history behind it. Honestly had found more soul in the abandoned mahabalipuram ruins en route Pondicherry from Chennai and a stronger pull than this

title: Beautiful
review: This is one of the two main temples in the total of 125 temples in the area. Built in the same style it gets somewhat second billing to Jageshwar main tample since most of the rudrabhisheks (lord Shiva's coronation) takes place inside the main temple. But the Mahamritunjay japs are undertaken here. To look at the temple styles check out the review of Jageshwar Dham by the same reviewer.

title: mesmerising
review: a very soothing experience to attend the AARTI at the temple. the Jageshwar temples are one of the 12 jyoti lingas on way to Kailash Mansarowar.

title: mahamruanjay temple
review: aura of temple and its effects can be felt ,moment you touch dandeshwar jageshwar temple.one of the oldest temple under archiological suryers of india,the effects on mind can be felt easily once you reach at its door.

title: Blissful experience
review: Must visit once. Only mahamritunjay temple. Love to visit it again and again.

title: More than 1300 years old, the oldest and largest temple in Jageshwar. Lord Shiva is worshipped as saviour from Death.
review: This Mahamrityunjya temple, built in 8th century, is the oldest and largest temple in Jageshwar Dham. When one enters the temple complex, this is on the right side. Lord Shiva is worshipped here as saviour from Death. The unique linga in the temple has an eye shaped opening.The faithful believe that chanting Mahamrityunjay mantra here is powerful method of self-realization, removal from the evil effects and freedom from all kinds of fears, illness and negativity.

title: Only in India
review: The temple is located at Jageshwar just 35 Kms from Almora city this is India's only temple and has been worshiped of lord Shiva, the temple opens on morning 7 AM to 6 PM evening.There some small guest house for accommodation and government rest house which can be booked in advance.On the occasion of Shivrati massive crowed comes here for worship.

title: Very old temple
review: Must visit place. Nature at its best. very devotional. No pandas, no Prasad walas irritation. Just sit & see the temple

title: Very peaceful temple
review: This place is with full of positive energy and peaceful ambience. I spend more than half day over here. I was feeling like fresh here. Just visit this place as this is awesome.

title: My spiritual abode
review: Jageshwar ji is a regular pilgrimage for my family. We find eternal peace and solace here. I haven't been to a place more calm and quiet than this.

title: History preserved amongst woods!!
review: A nice historical and religious place to visit. A large number of temples within one premises. Its lord Shiva's temple and one feels peace in the surroundings

title: Mahamrityunjay Temple "Lord Shiva" & Jyotirlinga Temple
review: Hindu Devotees worship at Mahamrityunjay Temple and Jyotirlinga Temple whole year and during "Sawan" People do Pooja at temple. this is land of Gods & Lord Shiva bless all here. Its Mahamrityunjay. Must visit this place with families and children "Om Shanti Om"
